gallery_slide.gallery_image_caption: Samsung's T1 is a tiny SSD external storage drive boasts 500GB worth of capacity. It's small enough to fit into a front shirt pocket and connects via USB 3.0.
For bringing high-resolution clarity to pen-based editing apps, the Wacom Cintiq 27QHD Touch lets you edit with four times the resolution of an HD monitor.
The Seagate Seven is the world's thinnest 500GB portable hard drive at .38 inches thin. It retails for $100. Learn more here.

Ricoh's Theta is a 360-degree camera that snaps immersive panoramic stills and videos. It pairs with mobile devices via Wi-Fi and a pair of 180 degree lenses with automatic, in-camera stitching. It costs $300.
Case Logic debuted a new Kontrast line of camera bags ranging from action camera cases to professional DSLR-sized packs. You can learn more about the new bags here.
Perfect for mounting an iPad or other tablet to a tripod or lightstand, Octa's mounts can be securely fastened to a range of items. It will set you back $100.

Apple is notoriously stingy with the internal memory of the iPhone but the iBridge, from Leef, gives you a workaround. It connects to your iPhone via the Lightning connector to provide additional memory storage. Capacities range from 16GB to 256GB, with prices between $60 and $400.

LaCie's 4TB Rugged RAID portable drive offers RAID 0 or 1 configurations to secure your files. It's dust and water resistant and can survive a drop from up to five feet. It will retail for $450 when it ships in the first quarter.

The new AF-S Nikkor 300mm F/4 lens arrives in February. It's a pound and a half lighter and 30 percent smaller than the model it replaces thanks to its phase fresnel optical element. It will retail for $2,000.

TTRobotics' Sea Wolf TTR-SB is a remotely operated vehicle designed to take action cameras under the waves. It can swim around in up to 30 feet of water and comes in a wireless or wired configuration to let land-based operators steer the Sea Wolf. You can learn more here.

VSN Mobil's V.360 is a 360-degree panoramic camera that can pair with mobile devices via Wi-Fi or Bluetooth. It sports a 16-megapixel backside illuminated CMOS sensor and is waterproof to a depth of 3 feet. It retails for $400. You can read our review of the camera here.

International Supplies showed off its Explorer series of hard cases. The company promises that they're "virtually indestructible" (they're certainly CES proof) and you can learn more about the series here.
